intro: Anthemis guadielae, commonly known as the Guadiela's anthemis, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
